adjectives.description: verminous (comparative more verminous, superlative most verminous)

examples: The old beggar kept a verminous mongrel dog for a pet.
The dog was constantly scratching his many verminous sores and welts.

entries.meaning: Actively unpleasant, contemptible, or otherwise reminiscent of vermin.
examples: They had brought all their own equipment with them, trade by trade, tongue by tongue; they travelled in ancient lorries or in slower carts with their verminous armfuls of keen-eyed children.
